title: Inconsistent dependability
text:
Based on the reviews on this web site, two years ago, I purchased five of the cameras. I installed them around the house. I use them as security monitors and as a way to keep up with the pets when we are not at home. 

One of the cameras has failed completely. Two of the cameras shut down frequently and require rebooting to come back on line. One of the units, the only one of my five that I have mounted outdoors, under the eve of the front porch, functions well. It requires only minor tweaking every month or so. 

The fifth unit functions relatively well. On occasion the picture washes out, but it often resets itself, or it too requires rebooting!

I suppose for the money I invested in the cameras, I should be disappointed. I tell myself, "you get what you pay for!" But for the most part the cameras (with the one exception) are performing... but with some inconsistency!

That inconsistency is most troubling when traveling, and I call up the units on my iPhone and can access only one or two!  I'm fortunate that rarely are the four working cameras off line at the same time. 

On the plus side, and it is a powerful plus. Usually, I do have at least some audio-visual monitoring capability from any place in the world!
